subject: Cybersecurity
title: Section 215: The PATRIOT Act's Secret Surveillance Powers
description: A 60-second lesson on Section 215: The PATRIOT Act's Secret Surveillance Powers.

hook.text: Passed 45 days after 9/11, the PATRIOT Act expanded surveillance powers with almost no debate. It lasted 20 years.

buildup.text: The Act allowed mass collection of phone records, expanded wiretapping authority, and reduced judicial oversight.

discovery.text: Section 215 was used to justify bulk collection of every American's phone metadata â€” revealed by Snowden in 2013.

twist.text: Most lawmakers admitted they hadn't read the full PATRIOT Act before voting. It passed the Senate 98-1.

climax.text: The PATRIOT Act showed how quickly civil liberties can erode when fear overrides deliberation.

punchline.text: Passed 98-1. Most senators hadn't read it.

quiz.question: What did Section 215 of the PATRIOT Act enable?
options: Bulk collection of phone metadata on all Americans, later revealed by Snowden
